intro: Fumaria muralis var. platycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant produces distinctive, broad, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found growing on walls, in cracks, and along pathways. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and garden cultivation.
